subject: Climate & Environment
title: Monsoons: Lifeline and Threat
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Monsoons: Lifeline and Threat.

hook.text: Over one billion people depend on monsoon rains for drinking water and food production.

buildup.text: Monsoons are seasonal wind shifts that bring months of heavy rain to South and Southeast Asia.

discovery.text: Too little monsoon rain means drought and famine. Too much means catastrophic floods.

twist.text: Pakistan's 2022 monsoon flooded one-third of the country, displacing 33 million people.

climax.text: Climate change is making monsoons more erratic â€” longer dry spells and more intense downpours.

punchline.text: The same rain that feeds a billion people can drown them.
